b.span: Free COVID-19 Testing at the Ardmore Convention Center April 2, 2020

span.span: The Carter County Health Department will be conducting a regional testing drive thru location on Thursday, April 2, 2020 at the Ardmore Convention Center located at 2401 N. Rockford Road, Ardmore, OK. The drive thru times are 10:00 am to 3:00 pm or while supplies last. The tests are free and people must meet the all of the following criteria for testing:
·Sick with COVID-19 symptoms (fever and cough or shortness of breath)
People coming to the site need to enter the Convention Center from the south on Rockford Rd. Please no pets in the car. No walk-up patients will be tested. We ask people to stay in their cars.

hr.p: We are serving Grab & Go meals today at Latta School to children 18 & under. We will be giving food pantry food to children as well. We are delivering meals via school bus to Hoppe?s Trailer Park, Shady Oaks and Woodridge. Meals will be served from 1130 am to 1:00 pm.
We are serving a week?s worth of meals today. Meals will not be served again until Monday, April 6.

We will be serving a week?s worth of Grab & Go meals on Monday, April 30 at Latta School to children 18 & under. We will be distributing food pantry food to the children as well. We will also be delivering meals and food via school bus to Hoppe’s Trailer Park, Shady Oaks and Woodridge. Meals will be served from 11:30 am to 1:00 pm

We will be serving grab & go meals today starting at 11:00 at Latta School. We will provide each child with 4 breakfast and 4 lunch meals for the rest of the week. We will not serve meals again until Monday, March 30. Meals will also be served at Hoppes Trailer Park at 11:15 and Shady Oaks at approximately 11:45.

We have been approved to deliver meals for children at two more sites. We will be dropping off meals at Hoppes Trailer Park at 11:15 a.m. and at Shady Oaks at 11:45 a.m. All times are approximate. We will be able to serve children age 18 or younger.
